result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher R. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court authorizes transfer to Wood County.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain FTE and/or schooling.

Counseling.  If successful, defendant allowed from early release from probation after 6 months.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher R. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 10:05am. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears prose. COURT advises defendant rights to counsel. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 2 (dc/repeater) - crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (poss amp/repeater). COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self: a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 1 yr probation. CONDITIONS: Counseling; AODA; Absolute Sobriety- Drugs or Alcohol; Random Drug Testing; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge. If successful, Defendant allowed from early release from probation after 6 months. Defendant requests transfer to Wood County - Crt grants. Adjourned: 10:21am.
Plea hearing on June 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Motion and order to amend criminal complaint

Pre-trial conference on April 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 19, 2015 at 10:35 am.
Jury Trial on May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Absolute sobriety from drugs or unless valid prescription for meds. No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
